intro: Cattleya mossiae f. coerulea, commonly known as the Blue Cattleya, is a hybrid orchid prized for its striking blue-violet flowers. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. The plant features long, arching stems with showy, fragrant blooms that typically measure 4–6 inches in diameter. Its leaves are broad, fleshy, and arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water storage. This cultivar is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its beauty and ease of cultivation under proper conditions.
